page.title: 09Attitudes
page.content: Local people were asked what they condidered to be important problems at the moment. Many were very worried about the problem of{football violence,}saying that something had to be done but did not want the action to be too severe. Many people were concerned with the problem of large{housing estates}being built everywhere. They do not mind them being built but felt that their progress ought to be controlled. One lady remarked that having sailed on many rivers, it was noticeable that the housing estates had been built up around the area surrounding the rivers and flood plains. It was considered that the major attractions in the area were Repton School, the archaeological 'dig' and the church.
